inlineContent.text: . One of my favorite things about Wilson, and super smart people in general, is that they make you think in ways that you don’t think naturally.

content.text: While I agree with Wilson, I would add a caveat. Yes, you absolutely should dig deep. But

inlineContent.text: You have an obligation to dig deep into
problems. Another Twitter app, another way of fiddling with your email, or another technology based way of determining whether it is sunny outside

How can we use technology to reduce childhood obesity, stop food waste, end hunger in other countries, fix the education system or ensure freedoms for everyone? Important stuff in need of smart people determined to see something through.
That’s where we need to dig deep.

abstract.text: David Brunow, known as Brunow [ˈbɹunoʊ] to the folks he works with, is a human living on Earth. You might have something in common with him — if you think it is ridiculous that he is talking about himself in the first person here, so does he.
